ASLObject

Instances of the ASLObject class provide type-safe to an underlying asl_object_t of a given ASL_TYPE.

Typically, you would interact one of the ASLObject subclasses: ASLMessageObject or ASLQueryObject. However, you can also use low-level ASL functionality using the asl_object_t exposed by the aslObject property.

Note: ASLObject subclass implementations are only provided for ASL_TYPE_MSG (the ASLMessageObject class) and ASL_TYPE_QUERY (the ASLQueryObject class).

  • ASLType

    Represents the various ASL_TYPE values.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public enum ASLType: UInt32
  • subscript(_:)

    Allows the keys of ASL object attributes to retrieved using the attribute’s index.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public subscript(index: UInt32)

    Parameters

    index

    The (zero-based) attribute index.

    Return Value

    The key associated with the attribute at index, or nil if index is greater than the number of attributes.

  • subscript(_:)

    Allows ASL object attributes to be retrieved and set via the subscripting notation.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public subscript(key: ASLAttributeKey)

    Parameters

    key

    The attribute key.

    Return Value

    The value associated with key, or nil if there isn’t one.

  • type

    Indicates the ASLType represented by the receiver.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public let type: ASLType
  • aslObject

    Returns the underlying asl_object_t represented by the receiver. You can use this for direct, low-level access to the Apple System Log API.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public var aslObject: asl_object_t
  • countAttributes()

    Counts the number of ASL object attributes contained by the receiver.

    Declaration

    Swift

    public func countAttributes()
        -> UInt32

    Return Value

    The number of attributes.
